intro: Nasturtium pamparum, commonly known as the Andean nasturtium, is a flowering plant native to the Andes region of South America. It belongs to the family Tropaeolaceae and is characterized by its vibrant orange and yellow flowers. The plant produces edible leaves and flowers, which are often used in culinary applications. It thrives in cool climates and well-drained soil, preferring full sun to partial shade. Nasturtium pamparum is also known for its ability to attract beneficial insects like ladybugs, making it a valuable addition to gardens.
